basics.name: Bianca Brückner
basics.label: Engineering Manager
basics.summary: Experienced Engineering Manager, passionate about web development, organizational/team health and people & behavioral science.

work.name: Booking.com
work.summary: I currently lead a team of seven engineers, focusing on areas critical for our high-availability and high-scalability services, essential during peak times. I am part of developing a comprehensive tech strategy, with an interdisciplinary group of experts for the next 3-5 years, aiming to extend our messaging platform across multiple business units to deliver large-scale technical solutions. Concurrently, I am in charge of leading efforts to modernise legacy services within my team and the department to bolster system reliability and to create a culture that encourages teams to continuously improve. Besides that, I ensure that my team as well as the broader department is pioneering improvements in industry standards by adhering to best practices in software engineering and utilising advanced technologies like GraphQL and AWS. Additionally, I am in charge of overseeing the implementation of the new 'Request to Book' feature across several teams, aligning our offerings with industry benchmarks and to meet the needs of the customers. Moreover, my team is among the first teams to successfully implement a generative AI use case in production. Alongside my technical responsibilities, I am in charge of mentoring two other Engineering Managers, focusing on enhancing skills in feedback delivery and managing challenging conversations. As a stretch goal, I am participating in a company-wide technical initiative called Shift Left to help achieve company-level objectives. This initiative reports up to the VP level. Part of the initiative is to gradually roll out new Risk controls within 2024 and establish new processes amidst high ambiguity.

work.name: ING Domestic Bank
work.summary: I directed a diverse team of 15-19 engineers including internal, onshore, and offshore professionals, requiring effective cross-cultural leadership. I initiated the creation of a 'Testing as a Service' team, addressing a critical gap by providing essential end-to-end testing services and elevating testing practices across all teams within the IT Area. This initiative significantly reduced technical debt by prioritising quality and operational excellence. I managed Java APIs, legacy systems, Pega, and an array of DevOps tools, encompassing both internal cloud solutions and Azure DevOps. My strategic leadership extended to organising and facilitating events involving over 120 participants, ensuring alignment and awareness of progress across different teams. Additionally, I collaborated closely with the Risk department to address 800 findings in the IT Area. This effort included implementing regular risk meetings, designating risk champions within each team, and disseminating weekly risk updates through a bulletin. I also developed a custom dashboard to monitor all controls, which became a critical resource shared across multiple tracks.

work.name: Stippl
work.summary: Parttime developer for stippl.io, travel app (stack: Node.js, React, MongoDB, GraphQL)

work.name: ING Tech
work.summary: As a leader on an innovative software project, I spearheaded the development of an internal analytical platform, designed to visualise and analyse the API and interface landscape along with their communication flows. Following a successful prototype, I established and led a multidisciplinary engineering team to develop and deploy the first Minimum Viable Product (MVP) into production. In my role as Product Owner, I excelled in stakeholder management, effectively communicating the project's vision and establishing robust feedback loops with the community. My architectural responsibilities entailed designing the foundational structures of the software system, strategically integrating it within the broader enterprise ecosystem. Additionally, I contributed hands-on as a full-stack DevOps engineer, ensuring the seamless operation and scalability of the platform. Highlighting my expertise, I presented on graph databases and our MVP at the ING Annual Tech Conference, demonstrating the project's success and impact.

work.name: ING Modelbank
work.position: Platform Architect in a global program
work.summary: I contributed to the development and maintenance of a reactive microservice platform designed for full-stack architecture. This platform was strategically developed to be deployed across five countries as a part of a company-wide program. To ensure a successful rollout, I created a resource platform featuring self-produced technical tutorials on the latest technological trends and coding education. Additionally, I authored a comprehensive playbook for the five countries, guiding them in replicating and launching the same multi-tenant microservices architecture in diverse locations.

work.name: ING-DiBa
work.summary: Part of the ING International Talent Programme. I worked in IT Service Management, focusing on Incident and ITIL processes designed for implementation across multiple teams. After that, I worked at Virtualization & Cloud Services, where I honed skills in VM management, CPU stress testing, and gained valuable RHEL experience. Lastly, as a DevOps Engineer at Continuous Delivery as a Service, I focused on Jenkinsfiles, microservices, Docker, Groovy, and Java. I also presented on Jenkins and Jenkinsfiles at the annual ING Tech Conference, showcasing our advances in continuous delivery practices.

work.name: Siemens AG
work.summary: Developed a Configuration Management Database (CMDB) using SQL for my Master's thesis, focusing on improving data management and accessibility. Participated in Siemens' Women in STEM talent program, aimed at fostering diversity and enhancing professional development in the technology sector. Contributed to the Cloud Technology Expert Group, working on critical technology initiatives (company-wide Active Directory roll-out). Additionally, I was involved in the company's inaugural trial of agile methodologies, where I researched and disseminated best practices and processes to facilitate the adoption of agile workflows.

work.name: Dodd Family
work.summary: First working experience abroad, as an au-paur in Ireland. I was responsible for three children, ranging from ages 4 to 11.

volunteer.name: Nuremberg Institute of Technology (GSO)
volunteer.summary: I volunteered for the university as a buddy for international exchange students. I helped them find their way around the German education system, the city and bureacracy (e.g. bank appointments, registering in the city).

trainings.name: Architecting on AWS
trainings.summary: Official AWS-led Architecting on AWS training.

trainings.name: Managing People Program (MPP) and B.Champion Program
trainings.summary: Both are internal Booking.com programs, each spanning six months with one half-day per week, plus 1:1 coaching sessions. Examples of topics covered include talent management, feedback, influencing organizations and stakeholder management. The B.Champion program, specifically targets women in IT to assist with career progression.

trainings.name: Think Forward Leadership Experience
trainings.summary: Designed to help ING managers take their skillsets to the next level. Within four months there are series of group activities and self-steered online forums as well as one-one coaching to identify and build on the existing leadership skills.

trainings.name: ING International Talent Programme
trainings.summary: The international talent programme provided 3 global learning events with different sessions and trainings about personal growth and leadership skills, as well as the opportunity to work abroad.

trainings.name: Other trainings
trainings.summary:

awards.title: Yolante: Development program for women with a STEM background
awards.summary: Yolante program provided trainings (social skills) and mentoring from senior IT leadership.
